summary:
Private equity (PE) is money invested in private companies that aren't listed on stock markets. It's usually done by specialized investment funds. These investors help manage and grow the company, often providing capital for expansion, new ideas, or restructuring.

Private equity funds are long-term investment strategies, often in less liquid businesses. Some think these funds perform better than public stock markets, while others disagree. So, the success of private equity investments can vary.
title: Private equity
